string-array.item: Choose your main recipe type here

resources.string:
Stir fried pork with scallions 
Beijing Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 143 kcal 
Ingredients: 65g pork, 15g green Onions 
Seasoning: 2g ginger, 4g garlic, 2g cooking wine, 4g soy sauce, 2g vinegar, 2g salt, 2g sugar, trace pepper, trace starch, 2g monosodium glutamate 
 
Steps: 
1: In a mixing bowl, combine the meat, starch, cooking wine, pepper, and refined salt. 
2: slice the green onion into small pieces. 
3: heat a wok, pour in cooking oil, wait for the temperature of the oil to rise, then add the meat and stir-fry on high heat. 
4: Cook until the ginger and garlic are fragrant. 
5: Add the onion and stir-fry for a few minutes. 
6: add the cooking wine, soy sauce, sugar, and salt, then the vinegar along the side of the pot, and finally the MSG.

Lamb soup 
 
Per 100 g - Calories: 62 kcal 
Ingredients: 90g lamb 
Seasoning: cooking wine, 5g green onion, 2g ginger, pepper, dried orange peel, hawthorn, 3g salt 
 
Steps: 
1: Soak the lamb in cool water for two hours, changing the water at intervals of one hour. 
2: Wash the lamb with water and cut it into small pieces. 
3: Pour enough water into the pot, put the cut lamb pieces into the pot. 
4: medium heat do open the pot and skim off the foam, pour in the cooking wine. 
5: then add peppercorns, onion and ginger, dried orange peel and hawthorn. 
6: cover the pot, turn low heat and slow stew 1-1.5 hours later. 
7: the orange peel and hawthorn out, then sprinkle the appropriate amount of salt. 
8: turn the medium heat and continue to stew for 15-20 minutes and then turn off the heat can be eaten.

Cumin lamb 
 
Per 100g - Calories: 142 kcal 
Ingredients: 90g lamb 
Seasoning: 5g soy sauce, tahini powder, 3g cumin granules, salt to taste, 2g cumin powder, chili powder, pepper powder, cooked white sesame seeds 
 
Steps: 
1: Soak the lamb in cool water for two hours, changing the water at intervals of one hour. 
2: Wash the lamb with water and cut it into small pieces. 
3: Pour enough water into the pot and put the cut lamb pieces into the pot. 
4: medium heat do open the pot and skim off the foam, pour in the cooking wine. 
5: then add peppercorns, onion and ginger, dried orange peel and hawthorn. 
6: cover the pot, turn low heat and slow stew 1-1.5 hours later. 
7: the orange peel and hawthorn out, then sprinkle the appropriate amount of salt. 
8: turn the medium heat and continue to stew for 15-20 minutes and then turn off the heat can be eaten.

Sauted meat shreds with soy bean paste 
Beijing Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 162 kcal 
Ingredients: 50g pork tenderloin, 10g green Onions, 10g bean slices, 10g cucumber 
Seasoning: 5g sweet flour sauce, 3g white sugar, 2g sesame oil, 5g soy sauce, trace cooking wine, 5g egg white, trace starch, trace scallion ginger water 
 
Steps: 
1: cut pork tenderloin into thin shreds. 
2: add salt, soy sauce, pepper, cooking wine, cooking oil, mix well and marinate for 20 minutes. 
3: Place the bean skin in boiling water for 3 minutes and set aside. 
4: cut the white onion into thin shreds and the cucumber into strips; set aside. 
5: pour the sweet noodle sauce into a mixing bowl and stir in the sugar, sesame oil, green onion, and ginger water. 
6: marinated shredded meat, egg white, starch, and thoroughly mixed. 
7: heat a small amount of oil in a pan over medium heat, pour in the marinated meat, quickly scraped, and stir-fried until the meat shreds brown Sheng. 
8: in the pan with the remaining oil, pour in the sweet noodle sauce and stir well. 
9: stir-fry thoroughly, then add the shredded meat stir-fry. 
10: to evenly coat all shredded meat with sauce.

Grilled eggplant 
Beijing Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 65 kcal Ingredients: 60g eggplant, 10g meat slices, 5g carrot slices, 5g green pepper segments 
Seasoning: 5g green Onions, 5g garlic 
 
Steps: 
1: Peel the eggplant, cut it into hobble pieces, and wet the surface. 
2: sprinkle dry starch on top, then turn the eggplant pieces in the pot to distribute the starch evenly. 
3: Sprinkle dry starch on the eggplant pieces again, making the eggplant wet, turn the eggplant pieces in the pot, and make the starch hang evenly on the eggplant. 
4: pour the oil into the pot, and heat the oil to make bubbles around the eggplant block. 
5: cook all of the eggplant pieces over medium heat. 
6: if the surface of the eggplant block is hard, you can fish it out. 
7: frying pan , heat the oil to about 80% of its original temperature, then add all of the eggplant pieces and re-fry until the eggplant is cooked. Control the oil by removing it from it. 
8: Heat a small amount of oil in a separate pan and stir in the minced garlic. Stir in the sliced meat, carrots, and green pepper. 
9: Pour the sauce into the pan and stir until the gravy is transparent. 
10: Pour the fried eggplant pieces into the gravy, sprinkle with shredded green onion, quickly stir-fry, and allow the gravy to hang evenly on the eggplant. 
11: Remove from the pan and drizzle with oil.

Fish Head with Minced Pepper 
Hunan Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 113 kcal 
Ingredients: 70g fish head, 5g green onion, 2g ginger, 3g garlic, 10g chopped chilli 
Seasoning: 5g salt, a little pepper, 5g chicken essence 
 
Steps: 
1: Scrub fish head with salt, rinse off brine, and rub evenly with one teaspoon pepper, half tablespoon cooking oil, half teaspoon salt, and half teaspoon chicken seasoning. 
2: bottom onion, ginger, and garlic 
3: steam chopped pepper for 8 minutes on a false fire for 2 minutes. 
4: add minced onion, ginger, and garlic. 
5: heat the oil and pour it over the fish when it begins to smoke.

Granny smith 
Hunan Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 89 kcal 
Ingredients: 50g dried plum vegetables, 10g pork belly, 5g peanuts, 5g rice, 10g red pepper, 5g green onion, 5g garlic shoots 
Seasoning: 3g light soy sauce, a little pepper, a little salt, 3g chicken essence, 4g green pepper 
 
Steps: 
1: dried plum cabbage warm water soak half an hour. 
2: prepare the side dishes. 
3: chopped chili pepper, onion, and ginger are cut; garlic seedlings are chopped. 
4: Streaky Pork is frozen and cut into small dice. 
5: cook the peanut rice in the microwave oven, peel it, and then fry it in a frying pan to make it crisper. 
6: heat the oil in a pot, then brown the onion and ginger, then stir-fry the pancetta, add soy sauce and a little soy sauce for color, stir-fry the dried plum vegetables, add a small spoonful of water, stir-fry the chili peppers, then add garlic, salt, chicken essence, pepper, and pour in the peanut rice.

JinLin Roast Duck 
Su Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 265 kcal 
Ingredients: 80g duck, 10g potato 
Seasoning: 5g soy sauce, a little cayenne pepper, 2g ginger, 3g maltose, a little ground Chinese pepper, cinnamon, star anise, a little cooking wine, a little salt 
 
Steps: 
1: Wash the duck, control the water, rub it all over with salt, then add soy sauce, cooking wine, star anise, cinnamon, pepper powder, chili powder, ginger, mix these seasonings well, marinate the duck in it, place it in a plastic bag, place it in the refrigerator, and marinate it overnight. 
2: The marinated duck will be removed the next day and placed in a cool place to dry naturally. 
3: Next, dilute the maltose with a little water and brush the duck all over with a brush, making sure to coat all of the duck 
4: Line a baking dish with tin foil and place the potato slices in it. 
5: bake for 1 hour on the lower middle layer in a preheated 160 degree oven, after 30 minutes remove and brush once with maltose water, and wrap the wings and joints in tinfoil, after 1 hour turn the oven down to 200 degrees and bake for about 15 minutes.

Braised pork balls in gravy 
Su Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 261 kcal 
Ingredients: 60g pork, 10g quail eggs, 10g horseshoe, 10g bread bran 
Ingredients: 5g light soy sauce, 1g dark soy sauce, 3g rock sugar, 1g yellow rice wine, a dash of cinnamon, a dash of fragrant leaves 
 
Steps: 
1: prepare the ingredients. 
2: quail eggs cleaned in water, cooked in a pot, over cold water shelled. 
3: beat the meat into puree. 
4: peel and chop the horse feet. 
5: put the meat in a basin, add the eggs, chopped green onion, ground horseshoe, bread crumbs, soy sauce, salt, yellow wine. 
6: along with the same side of the stirring on the strength. 
7: put on disposable gloves, put the right amount of meat filling in your hands, and then put quail eggs, make the shape of meatballs, and then left and right hands back and forth to beat the meatballs a few times, so that the air is discharged, a little stronger. 
8: pour the appropriate amount of oil into the pot, heat to 80% hot, add the meatballs. 
9: deep-fried until the appearance of golden brown (oil should be higher temperature, meatballs under the frying pan to quickly set, not easy to fall apart). 
10: pour out the oil in the pan, add fried meatballs, water, soy sauce, soy sauce, rock sugar, brown wine, cinnamon, allspice, chili, star anise, salt, high heat boil. 
11: turn the small fire for about 30 minutes.

Chinese Yam in Hot Toffee 
Shandong Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 321 kcal 
Ingredients: 60g yam, 15g soft white sugar, 10g cornstarch, vegetable oil 
Seasoning: 3g light soy sauce, 2g dark soy sauce, 10g rock sugar, a little rice wine, a little cinnamon, a little bay leaf 
 
Steps: 
1: Peel and cut yam into hobnail pieces. (It is best to bring disposable gloves to prevent mucus irritation skin allergies). 
2: soak yam pieces with clean water, drain. 
3: pat on a little raw flour. 
4: the pot on the fire with an appropriate amount of oil to 70% heat, one by one into the yam pieces. 
5: deep-fried until crisp and hard, drain the oil. 
6: grease the pan with a little oil to prevent sticking. 
7: use another pot to add vegetable oil, sugar, the ratio of 1:3. 
8: stirring constantly over low heat. 
9: wait for the sugar to dissolve, continue to stir. 
10: when the syrup becomes thin, light yellow color. (Must not be high temperature) 
11: quickly put the fried yam pieces. 
12: turn off the fire stirring evenly.

Creamy Chinese Cabbage in Soup 
Shandong Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 97 kcal 
Ingredients: 30g cabbage, 10g shrimp skin, 30g water tofu, 20g milk powder 
Seasoning: 3g garlic paste, 2g ginger slices, 5g cooked corn kernels, a little salt 
 
Steps: 
1: Soften the shrimp skin in warm water. 
2: softened shrimp skin cut into minced. To be used. 
3: cabbage cut into cubes, water tofu cut into cubes. 
4: garlic cloves and ginger cubes are cut into minced and sliced. 
5: milk powder melted with warm water, set aside. 
6: the appropriate amount of cooked corn kernels. 
7: Heat oil in a frying pan, add garlic and ginger, shrimp skin, stir-fry. 
8: put cabbage pieces stir-fried for 2 minutes. 
9: put in the seasoned powdered milk. 
10: boil and into the water tofu block.

Braised Eggplant 
Shandong Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 69 kcal 
Ingredients: 75g eggplant, 5g green pepper, 5g tomato 
Seasoning: 3g garlic, 2g salt, 5g sugar, 10g peanut oil 
 
Steps: 
1: wash and cut the eggplant into cubes and sprinkle some salt evenly and marinate for 10-20 minutes. 
2: peppers and tomatoes cleaned and cut into pieces. 
3: garlic some part sliced, part chopped. 
4: the marinated eggplant will be clenched hard water, so that the eggplant can absorb less oil. 
5: the pan is hot, put an appropriate amount of peanut oil, then put garlic cloves bursting. 
6: smell the garlic aroma and add the eggplant, stir-fry over medium heat until the eggplant is browned and soft. 
7: put the green pepper and tomatoes, add a spoonful of sugar and salt to taste, stir-fry evenly over high heat, add a little hot water halfway through the stir-fry to make the tomatoes soft and red soup. 
8: sprinkle with chopped garlic before serving.

Braised beef brisket 
Sichuan Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 232 kcal 
Ingredients: 50g sirloin, 5g ginger, 5g garlic, 20g potato, 10g carrot 
Seasoning: a little star anise, 5g rock sugar, 3g Haitian seafood sauce, 2g light soy sauce, a little rice wine 
 
Steps: 
1: Cut the beef brisket into 40mmX40mm square pieces. 
2: Boil water in a pot, add the brisket and cook until the water boils, remove and rinse. 
3: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pot, add rock sugar and cook slowly over low heat until it melts and turns caramel color. 
4: Add ginger, green onion and star anise and stir-fry until fragrant. 
5: Add beef brisket and stir-fry until evenly colored. 
6: Add rice wine, seafood sauce, stir-fry until evenly colored. 
7: Inject of water, soy sauce, the water is higher than the meat, high heat boil and simmer for 90 minutes. 
8: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a separate pan and sauté the carrots and potatoes until light brown on the surface. 
9: Add the beef brisket and the stock to the pot. Bring to a boil and continue to simmer for about 60 minutes.

Wenchang Coconut Chicken 
Yue Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 144 kcal 
Ingredients: 80g chicken thigh meat, 5g spring onion , 5g ginger , 5g garlic 
Seasoning: 3g soy sauce, 2g sugar, a little sesame oil, a little vinegar 
 
Steps: 
1: Wash the chicken thighs, scald them with hot water first, then boil them in water, put green onion and ginger in the water and cook them at the same time. 
2: Chicken thighs cooked and cooled, chopped into small pieces and placed in a plate. 
3: Chop all the onion, ginger, garlic and chili, sauté in oil and add all the seasonings and cook well, serve and pour over the chicken thighs.

DongPo Pork 
SZhe Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 463 kcal 
Ingredients: 80g pork pancetta 
Seasoning: small amount of star anise, 5g rock sugar, small amount of yellow wine, 5g soy sauce, 5g shallots, 5g green onions, small amount of ginger 
 
Steps: 
1: Wash the pork first. 
2: Boil in a pot of boiling water for about 8 minutes. 
3: Remove and cool, then cut into 3cm cubes. 
4: Bottom of the pot with a few pieces of bamboo chopsticks built into the bottom of the well, arrange the scallions. 
5: Put ginger slices, place the meat pieces skin side down, nearly the amount of the dense arrangement of the best stuffed. 
6: Add soy sauce and fresh soy sauce, pour on the old yellow wine, put on the rock sugar, high heat boil to low heat and slow stew 2 hours. 
7: Take out the skin side up into a container with a lid, steam for 1 hour on high heat to remove. 
8: Boil the soup when stewing meat, add water starch thickening, pour on the steamed meat.

Stir fried pork with green peppers 
Sichuan Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 101 kcal 
Ingredients: 30g green pepper, 60g pork 
Seasoning: 5g soy sauce, 2g sesame oil, chicken broth, cornstarch, sesame seeds, 3g salt, ginger, garlic, soy sauce, cooking wine, pepper, sugar 
 
Steps: 
1: Wash and cut green pepper into 3 cm long julienne strips and marinate in salt for a few minutes. 
2: Wash the pork, cut into 3 cm long, 5 mm wide and 5 mm thick shreds, mix with salt and 40 g of cornstarch and marinate for a while. 
3: Put soy sauce and 35g starch into a bowl and thicken with chicken broth to make gravy. 
4: Heat a frying pan, add oil and heat to 70%, pour in the peppers, stir-fry over high heat and remove. 
5: Add 25 grams of sesame oil, heat, add the shredded meat, stir-fry a few times, pour in the shredded peppers, add a small amount of cornstarch, stir-fry a few times, sprinkle with roasted sesame seeds, ready.

Poached young Chinese cabbage 
Sichuan Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 11 kcal 
Ingredients: 90g Cantonese cabbage 
Seasoning: 5g salt, 3g chicken essence, a small amount of starch, 1g green onion, 1g red pepper 
 
Steps: 
1: Boil half a pot of water, add a small amount of salt and oil, into the cabbage heart cook for about 1 minutes. 
2: Put the boiled cabbage heart neatly on the plate, cut the red pepper and green onion into shreds and use. 
3: Heat the oil in the wok, add oyster sauce and umami juice, add shredded red pepper and stock, boil until slightly boiling, add a little starch. 
4: Put shredded red pepper and scallion on the cabbage, and drizzle the soup on the cabbage.

Steamed Yellow Croaker 
Yue Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 209 kcal 
Ingredients: Yellowtail 90g 
Seasoning: ginger, onion 3g, steamed fish soya sauce 5g,, salt 2g 
 
Steps: 
1: Ginger cut half into slices, half cut into shreds, white onion cut sections, cut the leaves of the electrum not. The bottom of the plate lay onion and ginger slices 
2: Yellow croaker collection hitch open, split open, the fish body smeared with a thin layer of salt marinated for 10 minutes, laid on the plate, the fish and then placed on the cut ginger shreds. 
3: The pot of water boiling and put the marinated fish into the pot, steam for seven minutes on high heat. 
4: Out of the pot and pour off the water steamed out of the dish. 
5: Two tablespoons of steamed fish soy sauce. 
6: Sprinkle with chopped green onion. 
7: Another pot to heat up two spoons of cooking oil drizzled on the fish.

BBQ Pork with Honey Sauce 
Yue Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 206 kcal 
Ingredients: 90g pork belly 
Seasoning: 3g char siu sauce, 3g oyster sauce, 2g light soy sauce, shredded ginger, 2g honey 
 
Steps: 
1: After peeling and washing the pork belly, cut two sections. 
2: Place in a clean, dry crisper and sprinkle with shredded ginger. 
3: Pour in 2 tablespoons of char siu sauce, 1 tablespoon of light soy sauce and 1 tablespoon of oil. 
4: After mixing, cover and refrigerate for two days. During this period, the meat should be turned many times to fully taste the meat. 
5: After two days, remove the meat from the refrigerator and defrost for half an hour. 
6: Preheat the oven at 190°, line a non-stick baking tray with tinfoil, put the meat and a little juice on it and send it to the middle oven for 30 minutes. 
7: 5 minutes to turn once, 10 minutes after the start of the honey, brush a layer of honey before the oven. 
8: When the temperature drops slightly after coming out of the oven, start slicing.

Hakka stuffed tofu 
 Yue Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 89 kcal 
Ingredients: 50g tofu, 20g minced pork, 20g egg 
Seasoning: chopped cilantro, scallion, starch, 3g sugar, 3g salt, chopped pepper, 2g oyster sauce, 2g soy sauce 
 
Steps: 
1: Add chopped green onion, egg mixture, salt and soy sauce to the minced pork and mix well. 
2: Cut the triangle of oil tofu in half, hollow out the middle, stuff it with the stirred minced pork and smooth it out. 
3: Wrap the oiled tofu stuffed with meat into a pot of cold water and cook 
4: Mix the seasoning with minced cilantro, chopped pepper, oyster sauce, sugar and appropriate amount of water, and add a little of the water used to cook the oil tofu to thicken it, pour it into the pot and cook together.

Sweet and Sour Pork Tenderloin 
 Yue Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 267 kcal 
Ingredients: 65g minced pork, 20g egg 
Seasoning: 5g tomato sauce, scallion, starch, 5g sugar, salt, chopped pepper, 3g oyster sauce, 2g soy sauce 
 
Steps: 
1: Fresh tenderloin meat cut into long strips. Marinate the meat with salt and wine, then coat with egg white and cornstarch. 
2: Pour Spanish olive oil into the pan, wait until the oil is 6 mature, then add the meat and fry it until it is fifty percent dry. 
3: Pan oil left to pop garlic and pepper, add shallots, tomato sauce and sauté well. 
4: Pour into the meat and stir-fry, put vinegar, thicken, plate.

Ma Po Tofu 
 Sichuan Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 119 kcal 
Ingredients: 60g tofu, 25g ground beef 
Seasoning: 3g minced green garlic, 3g minced ginger and garlic, edible oil, salt, 3g soy sauce, 5g red oil bean paste, bean drum, cayenne pepper powder, 1g chicken essence, cooking wine 
 
Steps: 
1: Prepare the materials, beef chopped into minced in advance. 
2: Beef with salt, soy sauce, cooking wine stir well marinated for 10 minutes. 
3: Tofu cut into pieces, let go of water blanching, boil water and cook for 5 minutes. 
4: Hot pan with cool oil, add ginger and garlic stir-fried aroma and add beef stir-fried until browned. 
5: Add chopped bean drums, red oil bean paste, chili powder stir-fry well. 
6: Add a small amount of water and then add blanched tofu and simmer for ten minutes. 
7: Add pepper powder, chicken seasoning stir-fry well, add some water starch and stir well, then plate, sprinkle with minced green garlic.

Double cooked pork 
 Sichuan Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 315 kcal 
Ingredients: 60g pork belly, 10g green pepper, 10g green garlic, 10g red pepper 
Seasoning: 5g Pixian thick broad-bean sauce, 2g black bean sauce, 3g white sugar, chicken essence, peanut oil 
 
Steps: 
1: Cold water under the meat, boil over high heat, cook until the meat is just cooked, and then cut into thin slices after the meat is cool. 
2: Cold water under the meat, boil over high heat, cook until the meat is just cooked (with chopsticks can penetrate without seeping blood), and then cut into thin slices after the meat cools. 
3: Frying pan, stir-fry the meat slices. 
4: To be a little volume of meat out of the oil, under the PI County bean paste stir-fry well. 
5: Then add the chopped tempeh stir-fry. 
6: Add green and red pepper, stir-fry until broken green. 
7: Add the green garlic stir-fried aroma. 
8: Finally, then add sugar, chicken seasoning can be removed from the pot.

Braised beef brisket 
 Sichuan Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 268 kcal 
Ingredients: 70g chicken breast, 10g green onion, 10g fried peanuts, a few pieces of chili pepper 
Seasoning: 2g salt, 3g soy sauce, 1g dark soy sauce, balsamic vinegar, 3g sugar, ginger juice, garlic paste, 2g chicken seasoning, pepper powder, white pepper, cooking wine 
 
Steps: 
1: Pat the chicken breast with the back of a knife and cut into thumbnail-sized dice. 
2: Marinate with 1 tablespoon cooking wine, ½ tablespoon cooking oil, ½ teaspoon white pepper, ½ teaspoon salt and 1 teaspoon cornstarch for 10 minutes to taste. 
3: Cut green onion into pieces. 
4: Heat oil in a pot and stir-fry the diced chicken at 70% to 80% heat. 
5: Add dried chili, green onion and a teaspoon of pepper and stir-fry to bring out the fragrance. 
6: Blend into the sauce, high heat stir-fry until sticky dry loose. 
7: Turn off the heat, mix in the peanut rice.

Sliced Beef and Ox Tongue in Chilli Sauce 
 Sichuan Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 138 kcal 
Ingredients: 20g beef tendon, 20g beef tripe, 10g beef tongue, 10g beef tendon, 10g beef heart, 5g sesame seeds, 5g peanuts without skin 
Seasoning: 5g chili powder, crushed chili pepper, pepper, cloves, cinnamon, cumin, herb nuts, star anise, allspice, ginger, 5g green onion, comfrey, salad oil, 5g soy sauce, soy sauce, rock sugar, 5g brown sugar 
 
Steps: 
1: Boiling red oil preparation materials: chili powder 4/3 cup, chili pepper 1/4 cup (1 cup = 250 ml the same below), pepper 1 tablespoon, cloves 3, cinnamon half a small strip, cumin 1 small spoon, herb nuts 1, star anise 4, allspice 3 pieces, ginger 1 small piece, green onion 3 sections, sesame 1 tablespoon, comfrey 1 small section. Add 200 grams of peanuts without skin and 600 grams of salad oil (or vegetable oil). 
2: Oil poured into the pan, oil temperature slightly hot add peanuts, fry over moderate heat until slightly yellow and crispy. 
3: Fish out, part can be used as ingredients. 
4: Add the other ingredients listed above (except sesame seeds) to the frying pan and immediately turn to the lowest heat. Simmer for 1 hour, then add sesame seeds and simmer for another 15 minutes. 
5: Pour all the ingredients in the frying pan into a bowl. 
6: After soaking for 1 day, remove the residue and drain out the red oil. Save for multiple use. 
7: Boil soy sauce preparation materials: 1 cup of soy sauce, 3 tablespoons of soy sauce, 1 small piece of rock sugar, 3 tablespoons of brown sugar, peppercorns, star anise, cumin, allspice, ginger, scallions. All the above ingredients are shown in the picture. 
8: All the ingredients into the pot, boil and turn to simmer for 30 minutes. 
9: Strain out the residue. 
10: Soy sauce into a container to save, can be used many times. 
11: The third step: cooking beef and modulating red oil sauce water not over the beef, add the right amount of cooking wine, salt, star anise, green onions and ginger will be cooked until slightly rotten. Can be difficult to cook parts such as tendons, tendons, etc. cooked in a pressure cooker. 
12: Cooked beef miscellaneous removed and cooled, cut into thin slices and placed in a bowl of some depth. 
13: Prepare stock, season with salt and chicken seasoning (I used clear chicken stock already has a taste. 
14: Make red oil sauce: the ratio is about: red oil half a cup, half a cup of stock, boiled soy sauce 3 tablespoons, pepper powder half a small spoon, sesame oil 1 tablespoon, salt half a small spoon. 
15: The seasoned red oil sauce poured on the beef (the amount of red oil sauce to grasp the amount of beef can be soaked in it), plus chopped green onions, cilantro and fried peanuts.

West Lake fried fish in vinegar 
 Zhe Cuisine 
 
Per 100g - calories: 122 kcal 
Ingredients: 80g grass carp 
Seasoning: Chili powder, crushed chili pepper, Sichuan peppercorns, cloves, cinnamon, cumin, grass nuts, star anise, sesame leaves, 5g ginger, 5g shallot, comgrass, salad oil, 3g soy sauce, 3g dark soy sauce, 3g rock sugar, 1g brown sugar 
 
Steps: 
1: First cut the spring onion into sections, ginger slice and set aside. 
2: Wash the fish with boiling water, scrape the mucus of the fish body with a knife, and then break the fish with a knife, and cut the flower knife on the fish body. 
3: Pour water into the pot, add scallion segments and ginger slices, and season with rice wine, salt, pepper and monosodium glutamate. 
4: The water is boiling down into the fish, when the water is boiling again switch the fire. 
5: Turn off the heat, cover the pot and stew for 5 minutes. 
6: At this time, heat another pot, add a little oil to stir stir ginger, then cook into the rice wine, pour 150ml fish soup. 
7: Add 50 grams of balsamic vinegar, 2 tablespoons of sugar about 40 grams, and 2 grams of salt. 
8: When the soup is boiling, thicken with starch. 
9: Drizzle with sweet and sour sauce and serve.

Braised beef brisket 
 
 
Per 100g - calories: 145 kcal 
Ingredients: 70g chicken, 10g spring onion, 5g ginger, 5g garlic, millet pepper 
Seasoning: Oil, cooking wine, 5g light soy sauce, 2g dark soy sauce, 3g salt, five-spice powder, black pepper 
 
Steps: 
1: After the chicken is washed, use 2 tablespoons of five-spice powder and 2 tablespoons of salt and an appropriate amount of black pepper, marinate it, prick a few holes and massage to help taste, wrap it with plastic wrap and leave it for half an hour. Cut the scallions into sections and cut the ginger into thick slices. 
2: Take a small bowl, add 3 spoons of cooking wine and 2 spoons of light soy sauce, stir well, cover the pot with oil and ginger, anti-stick spread on the green onion segment, put the cured chicken on the sauce just mixed. 
3: Do not add water, after the fire boils, turn the heat to simmer 20 minutes to open the lid, put some scallion on the chicken add two spoons of light soy sauce, a spoon of dark soy sauce, color evenly. 
4: Cover the pot and simmer for 10-15 minutes.

Egg Seaweed Soup 
 
 
Per 100g - calories: 36 kcal 
Ingredients: 50g nori, 30g egg, 10g shrimp 
Seasoning: 5g scallion, sesame oil, 3g monosodium glutamate, 2g salt 
 
Steps: 
1: Wash and shred the seaweed and put it into a bowl. Add two-thirds of the shrimps. 
2: Put the right amount of water in the pot to boil, and then pour into the mixed egg liquid. 
3: Such as frangipani float, add salt, MSG and then pour the soup into the seaweed bowl, drizzle 2, 3 drops of sesame oil, and finally sprinkle with green onion.

Lamb stew with carrots 
 
 
Per 100g - calories: 144 kcal 
Ingredients: 30g carrot, 60g lamb 
Seasoning: cooking wine, 2g green onion, 2g ginger, 2g garlic, 2g sugar, 2g salt, sesame oil 
 
Steps: 
1: Wash and drain the carrots and lamb, and cut the carrots and lamb into pieces. 
2: Put the lamb into boiling water and blanch, then drain. 
3: Put the lamb in a frying pan, add the salad oil and stir-fry the lamb over high heat until the color turns white. 
4: Add carrots, water and other seasonings (except sesame oil) into the pot and bring to a boil over high heat.

Beef Brisket with Tomatoes in Casserole Beef 
 
 
Per 100g - calories: 141 kcal 
Ingredients: 50g beef brisket, 30g tomato, 10g onion 
Seasoning: ginger, 5g tomato sauce, 5g soy sauce, cooking wine, salt

3: Heat the oil in a casserole dish under the ginger. 
4: Stir-fry the onion. 
5: Under the tomatoes stir-fry. 
6: The tomatoes stir-fried until rotten soft state. 
7: Add water to boil. 
8: Add beef brisket. 
9: Add the appropriate amount of tomato sauce, wine and soy sauce turn low heat and stew for about 1 hour. Use chopsticks to hold the lid on the pot to prevent overflow. 
10: Brisket stewed with a little salt to taste and then stew for about 20 minutes.

4: Boil and add shrimp.

6: Add oil to another pot.

Pineapple with Shrimp Balls 
 
 
Per 100g - calories: 128 kcal

4: Red bell pepper and green bell pepper cut into small pieces. 
5: Add oil to the pan, oil temperature of about 150 degrees, add shrimp, shrimp become red curl about 40 seconds to fish out. 
6: The pan is hot, pour in the oil, pour in the pre-mixed sauce (with the right amount of white vinegar, sugar, salt, tomato paste), first put the bell pepper, then put the pineapple. Finally pour in the shrimp balls, stir-fry so that the ingredients are covered with sauce can be served.

Steamed Egg with Shrimp 
 
 
Per 100g - calories: 152 kcal 
Ingredients: 50g egg, 40g live shrimp 
Seasoning: 2g green onion, ginger, 3g salt, cooking wine, 5g soy sauce 
 
Steps: 
1: Prepare the eggs, live shrimp, scallions and ginger. 
2: Shrimp washed, head, shelled and diced into small pieces, add white onion and ginger, add wine, grasp and marinate for a few moments. 
3: Knock the eggs into a bowl, add 1.5 to 2 times the warm water, add salt, stir well. 
4: Strain with a slotted spoon into the bowl used for steaming. 
5: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, place it on a steamer rack and place it under cold water. 
6: Cover and steam for about 5 minutes, until the egg mixture is solidified on the surface. 
7: Open the plastic wrap and add the diced shrimp more evenly, then cover with plastic wrap again. 
8: Cover and continue steaming until cooked through.

Roast Beef with Potatoes 
 
 
Per 100g - calories: 265 kcal

6: Add beef stir-fry, stir-fry until the beef is colored. 
7: Add onion, ginger, chili, star anise, stir-fry, add a little soy sauce and cooking wine. 
8: Stir-fry evenly, add the right amount of water, boil, add potatoes and carrots, put the right amount of salt to taste.

Per 100g - calories: 134 kcal

4: Reserve the oil in the pot, add dried chillies and peppers and stir-fry until fragrant, then add the sliced beef and stir-fry well. 
5: Add stock, wine, five spice powder, sugar, boil and then add chili powder, cumin and stir-fry. 
6: Add red oil, monosodium glutamate, sesame oil, stir-fry evenly, plate, sprinkle with sesame seeds.

Lamb Dumplings

Mushrooms mixes in the hot pot

Stewed Chicken with Mushrooms 
 
 
Per 100g - calories: 89 kcal

Braised chicken 
 
Per 100g - calories: 120 kcal 
Ingredients: 70g chicken 
Seasoning: ginger, cooking wine, 1g five spice powder, 2g soy sauce, oyster sauce, asparagus, 10g dried shiitake mushrooms, fungus, 5g green pepper, 5g red pepper, 2g shallot, dried red pepper, garlic, 2g salt, 2g rock sugar, 1g soy sauce, cooking oil 
 
Steps: 
1: Shiitake mushrooms soaked in advance. 
2: Wood ear soaked in advance. 
3: Asparagus cut into pieces, washed and soaked in water to remove the astringent taste. 
4: Chicken chopped into walnut pieces, soaked in water in advance, changing water several times in between, until the water is clear. 
5: Soaked chicken with sterilized tea towels or kitchen paper to absorb moisture. 
6: Add 5 or 6 slices of ginger, 1 tbsp of cooking wine, 1 tsp of five spice powder, 1/2 tsp of salt, 1 tbsp of soy sauce, 1 tbsp of oyster sauce and grasp well, marinate for more than 20 minutes。 
7: Drain the asparagus and set aside; cut the mushrooms into coarse shreds and set aside; wash and tear the fungus into small pieces and set aside; cut the scallions diagonally and set aside; cut the garlic into minced pieces and set aside; scrub the dried red chili peppers and set aside; if you add green and red chili peppers, you should also prepare them at this time; clarify the water of soaking mushrooms and set aside. 
8: Boil the water with mushrooms or heat it in microwave oven until it is close to boiling, set aside. 
9: Oil in a pan, hot pan cool oil low heat, add chicken pieces and all the marinade, slowly stir-fry until the chicken is oily, the surface is golden brown, set aside. 
10: Stir-fry minced garlic and dried red pepper, until the pepper is dark date red. 
11: Add the fungus, mushrooms, bamboo shoots, turn the heat to high, stir-fry evenly. 
12: Add the chicken, stir-fry evenly over high heat. 
13: Add rock sugar and soy sauce, stir-fry evenly. 
14: Add the heated mushroom water, not over the chicken; if the mushroom water is not enough, add more boiling water; boil over high heat, turn down the heat, cover the pot and simmer until the chicken is cooked, checking and stirring in between. 
15: Add salt to taste, and turn the heat to high to reduce the juice. 
16: Until the soup thickens, add the scallions and green and red peppers, stir-fry evenly.

5: Simmer on high heat for 10 minutes to thicken the sauce, sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve.

Three Cups Chicken 
 
 
Per 100g - calories: 175 kcal

Steamed Chinese Cabbage in Supreme Soup 
 
 
Per 100g - calories: 20 kcal 
Ingredients: 95g cabbage, chicken, ham, pork ribs, dried scallops, chicken breast, whole lean pork 
Seasoning: 3g salt, cooking wine, 2g green onion, ginger, water 
 
Steps: 
1: First boil the water broth. Put the old hen into a large soup pot, add water, ginger and green onion, bring to a boil, add wine and simmer for 3 hours. 
2: At the same time the chicken breast and lean pork chopped into paste, respectively, add an appropriate amount of water to mix into a porridge for use. 
3: After the soup has simmered for 3 hours, use a sieve to separate out all the soup dregs and floating oil. Pour the broth into another pot, boil, add the pork paste and stir well, turn to medium-low heat, wait for it to slowly spread, meat paste float, use a small spoon to fish out the meat paste; then bring the soup to boil again, the chicken paste in 2 times, according to the same treatment of pork paste; finally, the broth is thoroughly separated from the dregs, remove the oil, to be fresh and clear as water, salt to taste, to be used. 
4: Divide the soup into two pots. Select the tender cabbage hearts, put them into one of the pots of broth, sear them until they are seventy years old, rinse them in clear water to cool them, pierce them repeatedly with a fine silver needle, put them in a colander and drizzle them down with the original broth from above until they are hot. 
5: Put the cabbage heart on the bottom of the bowl, boil another pot of broth and ladle into the bowl.

Buddha Jumps Over The Wall 
 
 
Per 100g - calories: 175 kcal 
Ingredients: 10g skate sharks fin, 10g baby abalone, 10g scallop, 10g shrimp, 10g quail egg, 10g sliced asparagus, 10g shiitake mushroom, 10g cooked chicken, 10g pork belly 
Seasoning: 1g ginger, 1g Shaoxing Hua Diao wine, 6g stock, 1g salt, 1g white pepper

2: Then lay the asparagus slices. 
3: Lay the mushrooms in turn. 
4: Then add the cooked chicken. 
5: At the same time, put in the shrimp. 
6: Put in the scallop. 
7: Then put in quail eggs. 
8: Then put in the pork belly. 
9: Lay the shark fins and spread them flat. 
10: put a small abalone on the top. 
11: Spoon half of the Hua Diao wine into the jar.

13: Pour in the other half of the Hua Diao wine and bring to a boil. 
14: Season with a pinch of salt. 
15: Then sprinkle in a little pepper. 
16: Ladle the soup into the jar. 
17: Cover the jar with a lid. 
18: Wrap the jar with plastic wrap. 
19: To seal the jar more tightly. 
20: Put the sealed jars into the cage. 
21: Cover the pot and steam for two hours on medium heat. 
22: After steaming, remove and cut the plastic wrap with scissors. 
23: Place a plate under the jar and serve.
